title: Democrats face off in Ohio for October debate
text:
Sen. Bernie Sanders’ campaign is struggling. Former Vice President Joe Biden has stalled in the polls, dealing with negative coverage of his son’s business dealings. Sen. Elizabeth Warren has risen to a tie for first. And Sen. Kamala Harris and Mayor Pete Buttigieg are rallying for relevance.

If tonight’s Democratic presidential debate in Ohio were typical, these storylines would be enough. But this isn’t like any televised debate in recent memory.

Story Continued Below

An unwieldy 12 candidates will stand onstage for three hours, many of them clinging to single digits in the polls after months of failing to significantly move the needle of public opinion.
